tool_description: Manages and formats etymological citations, ensuring proper academic referencing and maintaining source traceability for etymology research.

citations.description: Array of citation strings to manage and format

citation_style.description: Citation format style: APA, MLA, Chicago, Oxford, linguistic

source_types.description: Types of sources: dictionary, journal, book, manuscript, database, oral

verify_sources.description: Whether to verify source existence and accessibility

error_messages: Mismatched array lengths: citations and source_types arrays must have equal length.
Too many citations: Limit citations to 100 entries maximum.
Invalid citation style: Use one of [APA, MLA, Chicago, Oxford, linguistic].
Invalid source type: Use only [dictionary, journal, book, manuscript, database, oral].
Malformed citation: Some citations contain formatting errors or missing information.
Source verification failed: Some sources could not be verified for existence or accessibility.
usage: Provide citations array, citation_style, and corresponding source_types. Optionally enable verify_sources and sort_chronologically for enhanced citation management.

formatted_citations.description: Properly formatted citations in the specified style

verification_status.description: Verification status for each citation if verify_sources is enabled

citation_summary.description: Summary of citation types and coverage
